page.title: 07HOUSING IN SKERRIES 1985
page.content:
The houses in Skerries are very spread out although most of them are in the central belt of the island. There are twenty-nine inhabited houses. Of those, seventeen are old, small and stone built, mainly extended{croft {houses.}Of the rest, three were built around twenty years ago and four were built within the last few years. There are four{council houses.
All the houses on the island have the{Hydro-electricity}installed and they also have washing machines, tumble driers and lots of other{mod {cons.}The older people never even had these things until a few years ago and most of the younger people take them for granted because they have always had them.
